front.title: IPv6 Fragment Retransmission and Path MTU Discovery Soft Errors

abstract.t: Internet Protocol version 6 (IPv6) provides a fragmentation and reassembly service for end systems allowing for the transmission of packets that exceed the path MTU. However, loss of just a single fragment requires retransmission of the original packet in its entirety, with potentially devastating effects on performance. This document specifies an IPv6 fragment retransmission scheme that matches the loss unit to the retransmission unit. The document further specifies an update to Path MTU Discovery that distinguishes hard link size restrictions from reassembly congestion events.
